article.title: $ZZ →ℓ^+ℓ^-ℓ^{′+}ℓ^{′-}$ cross-section measurements and search for anomalous triple gauge couplings in 13 TeV $pp$ collisions with the ATLAS detector

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of these Feynman diagrams represents the dominant production mode of ZZ in proton-proton collisions at √s = 13 TeV?
What does the red dot in the Feynman diagram indicate?
choices: A Higgs boson vertex
A gluon interaction vertex
An anomalous triple gauge coupling (aTGC) vertex
An electroweak interaction vertex

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the solid rectangle in Figure 3?
choices: To indicate the region of excluded aTGC parameters.
To show the area where the dilepton invariant masses are equal.
To define the signal region where both Z boson candidates have masses between 66 GeV and 116 GeV.
To highlight the events where the Z boson candidates have the same transverse momentum.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of these statements about the Powheg + Pythia prediction in Figure 4 is **incorrect**?
choices: It tends to underestimate the normalization slightly.
It provides a good description of high jet multiplicities.
It lacks higher-order real-emission corrections that Sherpa implements.
It describes only one parton emission at the matrix-element level.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the shaded band around the NNLO prediction in Figure 5 represent?
choices: The statistical uncertainty of the prediction.
The total uncertainty of the prediction.
The luminosity uncertainty of the prediction.
The QCD scale uncertainty of the prediction.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main purpose of Figure 6?
choices: To compare the measured and predicted differential cross sections at different center-of-mass energies.
To show the extrapolated cross section compared to other measurements and theoretical predictions at different center-of-mass energies.
To demonstrate the dependence of the cross section on the choice of PDF.
To illustrate the effect of aTGCs on the cross section.
